p: Edible films are thin layers that are used on the foodstuffs and play a key role in the distribution, marketing, and protection of food products against mechanical damage and microbial and chemical activity. These films are biodegradable, nontoxic, and environmentally friendly (Bourtoom, 2008). Owing to the nonbiodegradable of synthetic polymers, the use of biodegradable materials in the food packaging industry has been considered (Ghanbarzadeh et al., 2007). The use of composite films is one of the most widely used methods to improve the properties of the films produced from one component (Cao, Fu, & He, 2007; Yoo & Krochta, 2011).
